comprehensive_overview: CLIP (Cross-Linked Immunoprecipitation) is a technique used to identify the direct binding sites of RNA-binding proteins on RNAs. It involves UV crosslinking of proteins to RNA, followed by immunoprecipitation of the RNA-binding protein of interest and sequencing to identify the binding sites.
core_features: Identification of RNA-binding protein binding sites on RNAs
UV crosslinking of proteins to RNA
